entry.content: Image: Fatshark Each class gets a full talent tree overhaul The meat and potatoes of Warhammer 40,000: Darktide have always been solid. It‚Äôs a blast to delve into the Hive City of Tertium as a psyker, veteran, zealot, or ogryn. The game‚Äôs combat is brutal, visceral, and deeply satisfying; the soundtrack is an absolute banger and I love the chats between each character class. But the game struggled to maintain post-launch momentum due to the systems outside of each match, like weapons upgrades,...

entry.content: Image: FromSoftware/Bandai Namco Fires of Rubicon‚Äôs OP weapons finally got nerfed FromSoftware released a new patch for Armored Core 6: Fires of Rubicon on Thursday, and three very overdue targets were struck by the nerf laser. Say a fond farewell to your reliably overpowered SG-027 Zimmerman shotguns, Songbirds grenade cannons, and Stun Needle Launcher. Those go-to boss killers were all affected by patch 1.03.1 for Armored Core 6. Probably with good reason, too ‚Äî the Zimmermans in particular ...

entry.content: IMAGE: Nintendo/Polygon One weird secret to making a good game Back in May, the gameplay clip that had everyone talking was of a lava bridge in The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. Developers were impressed by the game‚Äôs robust physics engine, noting that getting something like this to work in a game is an incredibly difficult task. But why is that? entry.content: Image: BioWare/Electronic Arts The Keywords Studios workers were laid off in late September All of Keywords Studios‚Äô unionized QA workers were laid off from the studio in late September after Dragon Age: Dreadwolf developer BioWare declined to continue its contract in August. entry.title: Scalable spherical CNNs for scientific applications | Google AI Blog
entry.summary: Posted by Carlos Esteves and Ameesh Makadia, Research Scientists, Google Research, Athena Team Typical deep learning models for computer vision, like convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and visio...
entry.content: Posted by Carlos Esteves and Ameesh Makadia, Research Scientists, Google Research, Athena Team Typical deep learning models for computer vision, like convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and vision transformers (ViT), process signals assuming planar (flat) spaces. For example, digital images are represented as a grid of pixels on a plane. However, this type of data makes up only a fraction of the data we encounter in scientific applications. Variables sampled from the Earth's atmosphere, lik...

entry.title: Scaling up learning across many different robot types | DeepMind Blog
entry.summary: We are launching a new set of resources for general-purpose robotics learning across different robot types, or embodiments. Together with partners from 34 academic labs we have pooled data from 22 dif...
entry.content: We are launching a new set of resources for general-purpose robotics learning across different robot types, or embodiments. Together with partners from 34 academic labs we have pooled data from 22 different robot types to create the Open X-Embodiment dataset. We also release RT-1-X, a robotics transformer (RT) model derived from RT-1 and trained on our dataset, that shows skills transfer across many robot embodiments.

entry.title: DynIBaR: Space-time view synthesis from videos of dynamic scenes | Google AI Blog
entry.summary: Posted by Zhengqi Li and Noah Snavely, Research Scientists, Google Research A mobile phone‚Äôs camera is a powerful tool for capturing everyday moments. However, capturing a dynamic scene using a...
entry.content: Posted by Zhengqi Li and Noah Snavely, Research Scientists, Google Research A mobile phone‚Äôs camera is a powerful tool for capturing everyday moments. However, capturing a dynamic scene using a single camera is fundamentally limited. For instance, if we wanted to adjust the camera motion or timing of a recorded video (e.g., to freeze time while sweeping the camera around to highlight a dramatic moment), we would typically need an expensive Hollywood setup with a synchronized camera rig. W...

entry.title: Re-weighted gradient descent via distributionally robust optimization | Google AI Blog
entry.summary: Ramnath Kumar, Pre-Doctoral Researcher, and Arun Sai Suggala, Research Scientist, Google Research Deep neural networks (DNNs) have become essential for solving a wide range of tasks, from standar...
entry.content: Ramnath Kumar, Pre-Doctoral Researcher, and Arun Sai Suggala, Research Scientist, Google Research Deep neural networks (DNNs) have become essential for solving a wide range of tasks, from standard supervised learning (image classification using ViT) to meta-learning. The most commonly-used paradigm for learning DNNs is empirical risk minimization (ERM), which aims to identify a network that minimizes the average loss on training data points. Several algorithms, including stochastic gradient...

entry.content: Posted by Micha≈Ç Januszewski, Research Scientist, Google Research The human brain is perhaps the most computationally complex machine in existence, consisting of networks of billions of cells. Researchers currently don‚Äôt understand the full picture of how glitches in its network machinery contribute to mental illnesses and other diseases, such as dementia. However, the emerging connectomics field, which aims to precisely map the connections between every cell in the brain, could help solve...
